reviews.review_msg: He is just amazing. His lectures were sometimes boring but still, they were mostly interesting, so I somehow attended every single class. It's not a hard class. However, it requires little readings and writings. You wouldn't have hard time doing this course. Highly recommanded!

Professor Newman is extremely knowledgable in communications.  He is NOT intimidating at all and is extremely friendly and approachable for help. As long as you complete all of the assignments, this course should be an interesting experience as it covers many interesting topics regarding mass media. Very reasonable, shows great videos in lectures!

Honestly, he's a nice guy, has genuine interest in the subject, and tries really hard to teach well. Unfortunately, he's way too long-winded and has trouble distinguishing between information we need to know, and information we don't need to know. This is the devil course they force you to take before you can take any of the other cmns courses.

I feel sorry for the Prof, people say a lot of bad stuff about the way he delivers the course but it's simply because there is so much material to cover that lectures constantly feel dry and lifeless. Newman himself is very nice and helpful and the TAs all seem to be pretty good although some are a lot harsher in marking than others.
Possibly the worst lectures I have been to in 2 years at SFU. You can barely understand what he is saying half the time. Take this class, its awesome...just not under David Newman.

Watch out first years! Here comes a course filled with readings and boring lectures that nobdy wants to attend! I constantly dreaded going to this class... he always goes way over class time with movies and no breaks... ever!!!

Darn it, Enda seems like the nicest guy on the planet but he and this course just don't mix. He's a slow talker and sometimes this really exaggerates the dryness of the material. Slides are posted online but are not very informative - take notes. But he's a very passionate educator, and always willing to help.
best professor ever , gpa boostr , good sense of humour and very kind and helpful
Anil is awesomeeee!!!!! I actually looked forward going to class; hes a funny guy who made lectures interesting and enjoyable. Class is a GPA booster for sure!

i found the topics very interesting. He sets lectures up well, however they aren't mandatory as lectures are recorded. I liked that he was very interested in teaching the course. Maybe a little keen with all the emails, but it was always a nice break in lecture when he would show a bunch of videos related to what he was talking about.

love his sweaters-they manage to remind me of xmas ornaments, namely the 1 reason why i attend class. ive nvr been so motivated to facebook or msn or do my hwk until i attended his class. i thought i didnt need a laptop.WRONG.you need it for notes to save your hands & your sanity! his final was killer on the hands. and his TA's? iono wt to say
This class has A LOT of reading and writing. Reading overload. Lectures are not interesting. The professor doens't make the class interesting.

I am a 3rd year student.  I usually receive As and Bs.  I have only received 3 or 4 classes in the C range and this is one of them.  Not because it is difficult, but because the marking makes no sense, and the T.A., Sherry Yu, is incompetent.  Ian Chunn is unclear, probably because his assignment guidelines, and his lecturing, are so convoluted.  Y

Ian is a nice guy and easy to approach for help, but he doesn't seem to provide that help very well. His lectures are the most boring of all lectures I'm taking this semester. There's one more week to go and I still feel as though I haven't learned anything. His videos are great though! His assignments are huge and tedious.
boring class... monotone voice... if you have Xinren Li you're in trouble because you won't understand a word he's saying..
She's a great person, but REALLY difficult to understand because of her accent.  It's hard to learn Communications from someone who can't speak a proper sentence.
